medical_history.chief_complaint: Intractable seizures occurring mainly at night.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Seizures began at age 10, occurring predominantly at night, usually within an hour of sleep onset, with a duration of 30 to 45 seconds, occasionally progressing to generalized tonic seizures lasting 2 to 3 minutes. Frequency has varied from 2 to 10 seizures per night.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of medically intractable partial epilepsy. No history of brain injury or infection related to seizures.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes multiple types of seizures, but neither parent nor the only sibling has experienced seizures similar to hers.
medical_history.social_history: Completed college and previously worked as a preschool teacher. Never smoked or used recreational drugs, consumes alcohol rarely.
